body_html:
The random outputs problem has been solved, attributed to a bug in Google Sentence Encoder, which was part of the graph, corrected in a later release. ( tensorflow/hub#74 )
But the reloading part is still a problem. I'm currently using sess.as_default(), and never explicitly closing the session, but this just keeps consuming memory on each POST request.
body_text:
The random outputs problem has been solved, attributed to a bug in Google Sentence Encoder, which was part of the graph, corrected in a later release. ( tensorflow/hub#74 )
But the reloading part is still a problem. I'm currently using sess.as_default(), and never explicitly closing the session, but this just keeps consuming memory on each POST request.
body:
The random outputs problem has been solved, attributed to a bug in Google Sentence Encoder, which was part of the graph, corrected in a later release. ( https://github.com/tensorflow/hub/issues/74 )
But the reloading part is still a problem. I'm currently using sess.as_default(), and never explicitly closing the session, but this just keeps consuming memory on each POST request.
